abstract: Lawyers for American Civil Liberties Union, on behalf of gay couples in Kentucky, request a federal judge order Rowan County clerk Kim Davis to reissue altered marriage licenses where authority of federal court is cited instead of her office; governor asserts state will recognize altered licenses.
lead_paragraph: Gay couples in Kentucky say altered marriage licenses issued by a county clerk are invalid and a federal judge should order her office to reissue them or put the office in receivership and have someone else do it.

headline.main: Kentucky: A.C.L.U. Wants Marriage Licenses Reissued
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: A.C.L.U. Wants Marriage Licenses Reissued

snippet: Gay couples in Kentucky say altered marriage licenses issued by a county clerk are invalid and a federal judge should order her office to reissue them or put the office in receivership and have someone else do it.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
